intro: Rhus esquirolii, commonly known as the esquirolii sumac, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like poison ivy and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically divided into several pairs of leaflets. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fuzzy fruits that are edible for birds and small mammals. Rhus esquirolii is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
